qas.question: Who is the current head of Comcast?
In what year was Roberts ranked as the country's highest-paid executive?
What was Roberts' yearly salary in that year?
What is Roberts power on the Comcast board?
Who is Brian L. Robert's son?
What percentage of voting power does Susan P. Crawford have?
What is Susan P. Crawford's salary?
When did Roberts become the CEO of Comcast?
What type of supervoting shares does Robert not have?

context: Comcast is sometimes described as a family business. <a0_0>Brian L. Roberts<a0_0/>, Chairman, President, and CEO of Comcast, is son of co-founder <a1_0><b5_0>Ralph Roberts<b5_0/><a1_0/>. Roberts owns or controls just over 1% of all Comcast shares but all of the <b9_0>Class B<b9_0/> supervoting shares, which gives him an <a4_0>"undilutable <b6_0>33%<b6_0/> voting power over the company"<a4_0/>. Legal expert Susan P. Crawford has said this gives him "effective control over its [Comcast's] every step". In <a2_0><b8_0>2010<b8_0/><a2_0/>, he was one of the highest-paid executives in the United States, with total compensation of <a3_0><b7_0>about $31 million<b7_0/><a3_0/>.
